title.narrative: CAPACITY FOR ACSD SERVICE PROVISION

description.narrative: By 2016, capacity of district health centres to provide and monitor basic health care, including HIV/AIDS care, is strengthened., which contributes to Child Health, Early Childhood Development, Health Systems Strengthening, Health â€“ General, Hiv â€“ General, Immunization, Maternal And Newborn Health, Nutrition â€“ General, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Sanitation, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2016, access and quality of basic social services (health, nutrition, education and care for HIV/AIDS) will be increased, especially for the most vulnerable, and the legal framework services and assistance for the protection of the most vulnerable children will be strengthened

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, capacity of district health centres to provide and monitor basic health care, including HIV/AIDS care, is strengthened.

description.narrative: Through UNICEF-supported micronutrient programme, 23 per cent reduction of anemia was observed in the Island of Principe. Support to provision of health care focused also on capacity building of all nurses nationally on Integrated Management of Child Illnesses or the provision of health supplies (vaccines, drugs and equipment). | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2016
